result.execSummary:
The defendant Jered E Hellerud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payments for restitution to be adjourned until 60 days after release from custody, then resume monthly payments.

superMiscConds.notes:
The defendant is to pay restitution of $1,249 for cost of funeral expenses

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office (see 'other' above)

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or undergo a course of education with at least part-time employment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Complete cognitive "Thinking for a Change" program

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jered E Hellerud

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Completed CIP on 5/8/17 - can be released to ES sibned TWB

From: Def Re: req restitution be put on hold until release or only come out of State pay not from gift money
TWB: adjourn payments until up to 60 days after release from custody, then resume monthly.
Sentencing Hrg held 6-1-15 w/ TWB - filed by Tina Bjerke
DOC-31 filed - signed by TWB
JOC retd B Barton - forwarded.
Pg 18 of PSI is re-scanned due to changes made
PO is Dustin Hines

State by Spec. Pros. Taavi McMahon  /  Def w/ Atty Brian Barton
Barton:  issues w/ PSI.  DOC won't amend PSI w/o CRT Order.  
McMahon:  I believe Mr. Barton had plenty of time for alternate PSI - I asked Mr. Barton if he was going to ask for continuance.  He said he wasn't.  Mr. Barton has right to argue sentence for his client - State objects to any continuance.  The charge was amended properly...
CRT comments...we can correct facts of the PSI.  We will go forward
Barton cites corrections on PSI
CRT makes approp. corrections to PSI - PSI may need to be rescanned into CCAP w/ changes
**PSI IS SEALED PER CRT ORDER**
J.R. gives statement / Robin L. reads stmt for J.R.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence filed
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Def sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence of 8 yrs:
- Initial Term of Confinement is 4 yrs w/ credit for 21 days;  25% of Inmate Funds to be applied toward restitution;  Def is eligible for CIP & SAP
- Extended Supervision is 4 yrs w/ conditions:  AODA & follow-thru;  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Complete cognitive Think for a Change program;  Obtain & maintain full-time employment or course of education;  Pay Restitution of $1249 for funeral expenses;  Pay 10% rest. surcharge to DA;  Pay CC & DOC fees
from Robin L, Victim/Witness specialist, Tremp Co.    re: Victim Impact Stmt filed
from Robin L., Victim/Witness Coord in Tremp Co   re: Victim Impact Stmts from R.P. & K.B.

From: Victim Witness Tremp Co 
  Victim Impact statement filed
from Tremp Co DA   re: Restitution request & Victim Impact Stmt filed

3:48 pm Def in court w/Atty Brian K. Barton.  William Neimer for Taavi Mc Mahon (Trempealeau Co.) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands
Amended Information filed.
Manuf./Delivery of Heroin (Fel)  961.41(1)(d)1  GUILTY
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements/questions gone over.  No firearms, voting, possible deportation advised.  There will be a restitution claim.  The victim rights act has been complied with.  No promises/threats to enter plea.
COURT finds a sufficient factual basis.  Accepts plea.  Found guilty and convicted.
PSI and an ALTERNATIVE PSI DUE by 5/15/15
SENT HRG:  6/1 at 3 pm  TWB  (1 -1/2 hrs)
Plea hearing on March 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on December 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

11 am  Def in court w/Atty Brian K. Barton.  Taavi McMahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karie Davenport Cattanach from the Dept of Justice

Preliminary discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds he K, V & I waives his right to a PH and accepted.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

PTC:  9/19 at 1:30 pm     STC:   10/16 at 10 am  TWB       Bond to continue.
